discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct. Service = layer 4, Application = layer 7

questions.question_text: What do you configure if you want to set up a group of objects based on their ports alone?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC are correst.
You can configure the following actions in an Anti-Spyware profile:
Default; Allow; Alert; Drop; Reset Client; Reset Server; Reset Both; Block IP
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/network-security/security-policy/security-profiles/security-profile-vulnerability-protection

Selected Answer: BC
B and C are correct.

Selected Answer: BC
b and C

questions.question_text: What are two valid selections within a Vulnerability Protection profile? (Choose two.)
Which three interface deployment methods can be used to block traffic flowing through the Palo Alto Networks firewall? (Choose three.)

An administrator would like to override the default deny action for a given application, and instead would like to block the traffic.
Which security policy action causes this?

comments.content: Agree, i would have said A. This is the most simple way for blocking the "traffic" as they ask...

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Drop-Silently drops the traffic; for an application, it overrides the default deny action.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/content/techdocs/en_US/pan-os/10-2/pan-os-admin/policy/security-policy/security-policy-actions.html

Selected Answer: A
The question is not asking for notifying anyone so 'icmp' is not needed as such, thus I select A.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is drop.

Selected Answer: AD
For PanOS 11.0.2, Under Device > Admin Roles > then try to Add
- By default, Web UI and Rest API will show enabled (checked mark) options for list of access
